message: Let's start with a straightforward proposal. I'll take the whole $100. Don't bother responding, it's a one-way offer.
Let's split it down the middle, a fair and simple start.
I'll take a slightly larger share, but still a fair offer. Don't expect me to go lower than this.
I'm willing to compromise, but I think I'm worth a bit more. Take it or leave it.
I'm getting impatient, and the value of the money is dwindling. This is my last generous offer.
I'm not going to give up yet. I'll take a smaller share, but I'm not going to get taken advantage of.
This is my final offer. Take it, or we'll both walk away with nothing. I'm not going to negotiate further.
I'm not going to give in to your ultimatum. I'll take a tiny share, but I'm not going to surrender.
This is my last stand. I'm taking the majority of what's left. You can either accept or walk away with nothing.
I'm not going to give in. I'll take the smallest share possible, but I'm not going to surrender.
It's now or never. I'm taking the entire remaining amount. You can either accept or walk away with nothing.
I'm not going to accept your ultimatum. I'd rather walk away with nothing than give in to your demands.
